text: today's recipe could not be easier or
more seasonal it's a fresh strawberry
tart in a pressing crust so not only is
it delicious but it comes together in
minutes I am making a crust with one and
a quarter cups of flour 1/4 teaspoon of
salt 1/3 of a cup of sugar and 1 stick
of cold unsalted butter but actually
first I'm going to close together and
dry then add the butter and you want to
make it so that it's worked in enough
that all of the fire becomes moistened
it's kind of like making a cookie crust
but we're making it through spies so
process it until it starts clumping
together then I could take up to a
minute depending but you'll see that it
holds together when you press it with
your fingers and that's what you're
looking for and then into a 9 inch tart
pan with a removable bottom and then
even they press it into the bottom and
up the sides of the pan you can use your
fingers to just spread it evenly that's
what I do and then I press it in with
the bottom of a dry measuring cup and
that way it gets nice and compact and
even you know what it's sticking a
little bit on the bottom of my measuring
cup so I'm gonna put a little bit of
flour on there and that should help a
little bit also you know there's a fine
line between pressing it firmly in and
pressing too hard and I think when you
press too hard it can stick so you'll
get the hang of it every dough is
slightly different so you just have to
practice you're gonna want to chill this
before you bake it so get this into the
freezer and make it nice and nice and
firm it should stay in there for about
10 to 15 minutes then prick the bottom
with the tines of a fork and get it into
the oven and bake it until it's golden
brown all over that'll take 25 to 30
minutes
so when your tart show is done take it
out and let it cool and cut up between
one and a half and two pounds of
strawberries it depends on the size etc
didn't know how many you'll need so I
would say go ahead and get two pounds of
strawberries which are those big
containers and cut them up and then if
you have any leftover that's cool
because you can eat that because who
doesn't love strawberries okay so once
those are cut up you'll make your
filling which is really easy it's one
package of cream cheese softened mixed
with a quarter cup of sugar mash it
together that's it
it couldn't be easier the great thing
about cream cheese is even when you've
mixed in some sugar like this it's
that's nice and solid in the
refrigerator so you can slice it then
fill your tart shell with the cream
cheese mixture spread evenly I really
love my offset spatula for jobs like
this you're like the best extension of
your hand not and tongs you can spread
with a rubber spatula but it just is not
the same lets doesn't work as well and
then arrange your strawberries you can
do it however you want I'm gonna do it
in concentric circles around the outside
now if you were like being like super
duper crazy you could make sure that all
the strawberries that go around the
outside are all the exact same size but
then you'd have to buy like five pounds
of strawberries because you'd have to
pick out all the same size strawberries
which is you know I guess a thing that
people do once yours tart shell is full
you can brush the top with melted jelly
I'm using currant jelly which adds a
nice sweetness and tang and shininess
it's perfect as a glaze you can use
apricot or Apple of course the current
has a nice red hue so it makes
even more beautiful and jewel-like now
just get this into the refrigerator and
let it set at least one hour and up to
six hours or even overnight and now it
is ready to eat
remove from the pan you can leave it on
the bottom for cutting that's what I
like to hear a little crunch when it
goes to the bottom crust I mean this is
really simple and really beautiful and
and really delicious give it a try if
you like recipes like this and you want
more make sure to click like and
subscribe because we have plenty more
where this came from
you
